name: Fragmentation
description: Wraps up a system we are performing a calculation on.

e032bde6-450e-467f-8a10-e1428c0ffd2d._description: This class wraps up any dictionary representation of an atom.

sym.description: The atomic symbol of this atom.

get_position.description: Get the position of this atom.

params.description: The units to get the position in.
params.name: units

set_position.description: Set a new position for the atom.

params.description: The units of the position being passed.
params.name: units

purity_indicator.description: The purity value of a fragment.

generate_id.description: If you don't have an id for a fragment, this will create a unique one.

split_to_fragments.description: Splits a given fragment in a system based on the mapping.

params.description: The mapping of atoms to fragments.
params.name: mapping
frag
params.default: defaults to first fragment in the list.

set_multipoles.description: Set the values of the multipoles of a fragment.

Q.description: Get the multipoles of the system.

plot_purity.description: Plots the purity values of the system.

get_fragment_by_id.description: Returns a fragment with the given id.

params.description: The id of the fragment to get.
params.name: param

params.description: Some set of atoms to build the list from.
params.name: atoms

params.description: The file handle to write to
params.name: file

write_posinp.description: Write the positions of the atoms into a dictionary format.

external_potential.description: Transform the fragment information into a dictionary ready to be put as an external potential.

e36e82d0-22ca-4c64-ac2f-03b487dfb749._description: A class used for writing to xyz files.

params.description: The name of the file to write to.
params.name: filename

params.description: The units to write to file.
params.name: units

closed.description: This is true if the file is not open.

fb1643bb-fec2-4e23-9e71-0aa9ada8ed78._description: A class for reading atoms from a file.

params.description: The name of the file to read from.
params.name: filename

closed.description: This is true if the file is not open.

iter.description: Will get the next atom from the file. The dictionary returned has the position and symbol.

units.description: The units of the positions in the file.
